description:
This module introduces graduate students to the principles and
techniques commonly used to tackle AI planning and decision
making problems. It examines how to pose and solve decision
making and planning problems in deterministic, probabilistic, and
adversarial environments for both single and multiagent
problems. Topics include deterministic planning, decision theory,
decision networks, Markov decision processes, game theory,
multi-agent planning, and reinforcement learning.
title: Principles of Planning and Decision Making
prerequisite:
(MA2216 Probability or ST2131 Probability or ST2334 Probability
and Statistics) and CS3243 Foundations of Artificial Intelligence
